activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#13954
ohcnetwork/care_fe#13934
activity.text:
> Context : This feature will be used by a user sitting at a billing desk, and the location will always be the same for all the payments they receive from all the patient. So, cache the user's location selection in the payment record slideover, so they don’t have to select the location repeatedly each time they record a payment
> 
> Expected UX
> 
> * Add a location selection cache in the payment slideover for better UX, and prefill the user’s previously selected location in the dropdown.
> * In case no cache is available, keep the location dropdown selection blank.
> * Even if the location is auto-filled, allow the user to edit it manually.

done, please review

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#13934
activity.text:
> * add a filter to show only active status locations in the dropdown

Done, please review

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#13990
activity.text: > could you tell me the order id in this url . Go to Facility -> Services -> Pharmacy -> Select Any Location -> Inventory -> Orders/Deliveries/External Supply -> View Any order detail -> Switch Location. When switching Location, it should not take the user to the same order detail in a different location as that location may not have access to these orders, instead it should take them back to the list.

[Community Guidlines](https://docs.ohc.network/docs/contributing/#how-to-contribute)
- Claim an issue by commenting on it and explaining your approach
- Wait for the issue to be assigned to you
- Then raise a PR

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#13696
activity.text:
> > the message shown is not consistent when input is focused and not focused.
> 
> Do you mean by styling like colour and text-bold ?
> 
> > I think we can keep only 1 message and get rid of the other to keep it consistent
> 
> Both are working for diff states which are focussed and non-focussed. Focussed one (which is black and grey) is the live validation when user types in and non-focussed (red in colour) is the zod validation which prevent form submission on validation fails and focus the field of error and this is also the reason of having diff styling in error messages
> 
> @SiddanthNayak

What I mean is, I dont think its necessary to have 2 different styles, state and translation key for 1 validation. 

We can just keep it plain with zod validation to keep it consistent across both states (Focused and Not Focused) as it is for every other input.
